alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 02 at 1:12PM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Little to no additional snow is forecast. Very cold wind chills expected with readings as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...In Kansas, Sheridan, Rawlins and Graham Counties. In Nebraska, Dundy County. * WHEN...From 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...There may still be snow on area roadways, but additional snow accumulation is not anticipated. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
